Location Name: Martinez, CA
Location Address: 150 Solano Way, Martinez, CA, United States (US), 94553
Job/Requisition ID: 59775
Education Level: High School Diploma/ GED Required
Relevant Experience Level: Entry Level (1-3 Years)
Driver's License Required: Yes
Employee Group: Regular - Full Time
Employee Subgroup: Hourly Non-Exempt
Shift: Rotating Shift

Position Overview

The Quality Control Laboratory Analyst performs analytical tests on samples of crude oil, gasses, gas liquids, gasoline, diesel, coke, process streams and waters. The Laboratory Analyst may carry out special testing for projects related to improvement of refinery processes. The Lab Analyst may be assigned to work either shift or straight days in any location of the Martinez Refinery.

Roles & Responsibilities
  • The Analyst may be assigned to the performance of any duties for which they have been trained or qualified. Specific responsibilities will vary with assignment and training. All assignments will include conformance to basic rules of conduct, safety and good housekeeping practices.
  • The Analyst is expected to perform work in a safe manner at all times, and to correct the unsafe behavior of anyone else working in his or her vicinity.
  • The Analyst is expected to always conduct business with others in a respectful and professional manner.
  • The Analyst is expected to manage the work load to complete their analytical duties in a timely manner.
  • The Analyst will be required to prioritize work and make decisions based on these prioritizations. They will be required to actively communicate with our customers during this prioritization process.
  • Analysts undergo a lengthy process of education and training. During this education and training process, work performance will be assessed by the Analyst’s demonstrated mastery of fundamentals, technique, principles and procedures.
  • The Analyst is expected to actively participate in their training process, and to improve their knowledge or maintain currency during any free time.
  • While performing analytical duties, the Analyst is expected to discern when there are any analytical problems, and work to solve those problems through troubleshooting and consulting.
  • While performing analytical duties, the Analyst is expected to discern if any particular analytical result indicates an abnormal unit condition and take immediate steps to notify the unit of the analytical result.
  • Performs other unspecified duties under the direction of supervision.

Education

POSITION REQUIREMENTS:
  • Minimum: High School diploma or GED.
  • Prefer 4 or more completed semesters of college chemistry.

Knowledge, Skills & Abilities
  • Must be medically cleared and physically able to work in all areas of the refinery and perform all job requirements outlined utilizing required safety gear. Must be able to lift 50 pounds.
  • Must obtain and maintain a Transportation Worker Identification Credential (TWIC) for ongoing unescorted access into Refinery from perimeter gates.
  • Must be comfortable working in confined spaces and high elevations and be physically capable of entering all refinery towers and vessels when/where necessary.
  • Must possess a valid Driver’s License.
  • Must be able to perform work in a team environment, demonstrating honesty and integrity, and show willingness to learn.
  • Must be organized and possess ability to keep accurate legible documentation of work.
  • Requires safe work practices to ensure safety is a fundamental part of every task. Follow all safety procedures and maintain good housekeeping practices.
  • Requires ability to respond to refinery needs outside of normally scheduled work hours and take ownership of all work performed.

Experience
  • General knowledge of refinery process units and process knowledge preferred.

Special Skills
  • Requires ability to pass a series of Written Science Based Chemistry tests.
  • Requires strong computer skills including but not limited to LTS, LIMS, M.S. Office including, Outlook, Word, and Excel.
  • Requires strong interpersonal skills; with strong oral, writing skills. Must possess ability to communicate effectively with all levels of the organization.
  • Knowledge of regulatory and industry requirements including but not limited to PSM, CCC ISO, OSHA, Cal OSHA, API, EPA and other applicable regulations preferred.
  • Requires strong mechanical and troubleshooting abilities on individual devices and systems.
  • Must demonstrate proper analytical technique.

Not Required, But Highly Advantageous Are
  • Personal experience in laboratory analysis, especially in refinery laboratory testing.
  • Personal experience with statistics and statistical quality control.

About Marathon Petroleum Corporation

Marathon Petroleum Corporation is a leading, integrated, downstream energy company headquartered in Findlay, Ohio. The company operates the nation’s largest refining system with more than 3 million barrels per day of crude oil capacity across 16 refineries. Marathon Petroleum's marketing system includes branded locations across the United States, including Marathon branded outlets. Speedway LLC, a Marathon Petroleum subsidiary, owns and operates retail convenience stores across the United States. MPC also owns the general partner and majority limited partner interest in MPLX LP, a midstream company which owns and operates gathering, processing, and fractionation assets, as well as crude oil and light product transportation and logistics infrastructure.

Travel Expected: None

Marathon Petroleum Company LP is an Equal Opportunity Employer and gives consideration for employment to qualified applicants without discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, sex, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, mental or physical disability, medical condition or AIDS/HIV status, ancestry, national origin, genetic information, military, veteran status, marital status, citizenship or any other status protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws. If you would like more information about your EEO rights as an applicant, click here.

If you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application process at Marathon Petroleum LP, please contact our Human Resources Department at talentacquisition@marathonpetroleum.com. Please specify the reasonable accommodation you are requesting, along with the job posting number in which you may be interested. A Human Resources representative will review your request and contact you to discuss a reasonable accommodation.

Equal Opportunity Employer: Veteran / Disability

Marathon Petroleum Company LP participates in the E-Verify program in some states in which it operates (including AL, AZ, GA, MS, NC, SC, TN, and UT). For more information before proceeding, please see details in English or Spanish. Right to Work Statement English or Spanish.

position: Work at Home HR Support Representative
whole_unnormalized_body:
Are you ready to work for a company that appreciates your skill set? Do you love working from home? Do you love making outbound calls and helping others? Omni Interactions is looking to add an outbound customer service representatives to our team.

In this role you will serve a very important purpose, you will be making outbound calls helping employees ensure they have the correct paperwork in place in order to take a family or medical-related leave (FMLA). Empathy and attention to detail are a must!

Responsibilities

Responding efficiently and accurately to callers, explaining possible solutions, and ensuring that clients feel supported and valued.

Engaging in active listening with customers, confirming or clarifying information and diffusing angry clients, as needed.

Building lasting relationships with clients and other call center team members based on trust and reliability.

Utilizing software, databases, scripts, and tools appropriately.

Understanding and striving to meet or exceed metrics while providing excellent consistent customer service.

Requirements

High School Diploma or equivalent

Strong Phone, Typing Or Data Entry Skills Required

Exceptional customer service, active listening, and verbal and written communication skills, professional phone voice

Understanding of company products, services, and policies

Proficiency with computers, especially with CRM software, and strong typing skills

Ability to ask prying questions and diffuse tense situations

Strong time management and decision making skills

Adaptability and accountability

Fluency in multiple languages may be desired.

HR Background a plus!

• Jobs at Fred Meyer:** **Based in Portland, Oregon with over 130 stores throughout Oregon, Washington, Idaho & Alaska, Fred Meyer offers one-stop shopping with store employment opportunities in apparel, home, food, pharmacy and home electronics as well as opportunities in our division office in merchandise and product development, store operations, customer communications, public affairs, food and pharmacy. We are always searching for individuals who share our passion for service, leadership, honesty and diversity. Whether you like working with people, numbers or ideas, you can find a home at Fred Meyer. And with stores and offices across the Pacific Northwest, we have opportunities for talented individuals if you prefer to be closer to the mountains, ocean, or city.
  • Company Overview: **Kroger Family of Companies employs nearly half a million associates who serve over 11 million customers daily through a seamless shopping experience under a variety of _banner names_. At The Kroger Co., we are Fresh for Everyone™ and dedicated to our Purpose: To Feed the Human Spirit®. We are committed to creating #ZeroHungerZeroWaste communities by 2025. Careers with The Kroger Co. and our family of companies offer competitive wages, flexible schedules, benefits and room for advancement.
  • Position Type:* Employee
  • FLSA Status:* Non-Exempt

  • Job Segment:* Asset Protection, Loss Prevention, Pharmacy, Merchandising, Retail, Security, Healthcare
  • Nearest Major Market:* Bellingham
  • Nearest Secondary Market:* Everett

At Nautilus, fitness isn’t just a job, it’s our passion. We strive to improve the health and well-being of everyone who works with us because we see the benefits of a happier, more productive, engaged and creative workforce. Our culture is one that promotes work life balance; offers continuing education on topics ranging from improving workplace skills to better financial security; and promotes the importance of getting involved and giving back to the community.

We're a leading marketer and developer of health and fitness products with some of the most recognized brands in the industry, including Nautilus®, Bowflex®, Octane Fitness®, Schwinn® Fitness and Universal®. We are currently recruiting for an Operations Coordinator to join our Logistics/Distribution team at our headquarters in Vancouver, WA.

Summary

As an Operations Coordinator reporting to the Manager of Global 3PL/Fulfillment, you will perform a wide range of activities, including producing/generating periodic reports covering Distribution, Logistics, and Global 3PL activity, with much of the information for internal use only (confidential). Regularly interact with global facilities and Logistics partners concerning (tactical) processing of individual orders, general operational execution performance, and monthly invoicing verification. This position supports the Custom Compliance team in their day to day administrative needs. Diagnose and liaison to our Customer Service team on orders fulfillment issues with the 3PL. Additionally, this role will organize/schedule Operation’s and Corporate related meetings, follow up on action items and manage projects as requested.

Essential Duties And Responsibilities
  • Maintain periodic financial and operational reports, preparing/reviewing/editing them for management review.
  • Consolidate activity-based reports across Logistics and Distribution (globally) for period SLA and financial/budgetary comparison.
  • Coordinate directly, on a daily basis as needed, with global partners assuring operational execution/agreed upon service parameters are met.
  • Develop and manage systematic capability to monitor/measure processes assuring global partner SLA adherence and invoice accuracy.
  • Execution of fulfillment/order processing capability within NetSuite and related or future applications.
  • Schedule and coordinate Corporate end-of-quarter (EOQ) meetings, maintaining takeaways and execution monitoring throughout each period.
  • Periodic Operations reporting may require follow-up/working closely with department leadership to track areas for improvement and activities leading toward goal attainment.
  • Work closely with 3PL distributions and Corporate Logistics to maximize shipping efficiencies and parts discrepancies.
  • Interface with Customer Service to improve teamwork between distributions and Corporate teams.
  • Assist with maintenance of import/export standard work, controls and collaborate with team members to drive trade compliance solutions for efficiency.
  • Work with cross functional groups to obtain information necessary for the Logistics and Distribution Centers.
  • Other duties and tasks across the Supply Chain may be assigned as necessary.


Qualifications/Experience
  • 2-3 years’ experience in a Distribution, Logistics, or Operations execution role.
  • High school diploma or GED required; Associate’s degree preferred.
  • Strong organization and communication skills required.
  • May require ability to travel domestically and internationally, approximately 10% of time (valid passport/travel documentation required).
  • Invoice processing/accounts payable experience preferred.
  • Excellent computer skills, including Word, Advanced Excel, Microsoft Outlook, and Power Point.
  • Demonstrated ability to complete necessary paperwork (invoice reconciliation, expense reports, purchase orders, etc) accurately and efficiently.
  • Experience with data analysis a plus.
  • Prior experience with NetSuite a plus.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Proven ability to multi-task and make decisions in a fast-paced environment.
  • Ability to monitor and manage projects.
  • Ability to work well with time constraints and deadlines.
  • Ability and knowledge to work in a multi-site organization and with diverse, cross-functional teams.
  • Willingness to engage in a broad variety of tasks in support of the Operations organization.

We offer a competitive benefits package including medical, dental, 401(k) match, ESPP, life & accident insurance, disability insurance, paid vacation and holidays, wellness program, tuition reimbursement, product discounts and free use of our employee fitness center for yourself and spouse.

Nautilus is an Equal Opportunity Employer and is committed to diversity in its workforce. In demonstration of our commitment to a healthier lifestyle, we are proud to be a smoke-free campus.

whole_unnormalized_body:
Visual Design Intern – Marketing Design - Part-Time (20 hours per week)

Do you seek to make visual decisions for marketing, brand strategy, and events that drive phenomenal
outcomes? Do you regularly obsess over the design details and aesthetics of your work? Are you
interested in joining a high-energy multidisciplinary team?

We are motivated by our collective passion for design driven innovation, and we are looking for an
ambitious Intern to join our collaborative Design organization in our Morrisville, NC office. You will be
comfortable with delivering designs in digital and print media. You can articulate your design reasoning
and feel comfortable presenting to a diverse set of partners. In return, our team will help you to grow as
a designer and gain experience to further your career! You will be part of the evolution of Valassis and
Valassis Digital's visual strategy and design language.

How You'll Make An Impact...
  • Design within branding guidelines for various media types including event collateral, marketing
advertisements, and marketing materials
  • Collaborate with writers, marketers, strategists, event managers, and designers during planning,
content creation, and design production
  • Explore typographic hierarchy, iconography, imagery, color, and texture to solve problems in
elegant and beautiful ways
  • Research, ideate, prototype, test, and iterate on solutions
  • Clearly communicate your designs with stakeholders and be open to input
  • Handle multiple projects at once
What You'll Bring...
  • A portfolio! Resumes without portfolios will not be considered.
  • Your portfolio will show diverse project work on multiple mediums and your visual design process
  • A strong attention to detail
  • Understanding of Design Thinking methods and approach
  • Strong Adobe Creative Suite skills
  • Familiarity with MS Office specifically PowerPoint
  • Ability to give and receive constructive feedback in order to refine designs and improve
  • Superior communication and presentation skills
  • Team player with an ability to work as a contributing member of a multi-disciplinary team
Who We Are

Valassis is a leader in marketing technology and consumer engagement, providing over 58,000 clients with innovative media solutions to influence consumers wherever they plan, shop, buy and share. By integrating online and offline data combined with powerful insights, Valassis precisely targets its clients' most valuable shoppers, offering unparalleled reach and scale. Our signature Have You Seen Me?® program delivers hope to missing children and their families. Valassis is a wholly owned subsidiary of Harland Clarke Holdings.

WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU?
We offer a generous total rewards benefits package that includes medical, dental and vision coverage, 401k matching and generous PTO allowance. A wide variety of additional benefits like life insurance, employee assistance and pet insurance are also available not to mention smart, friendly coworkers!

Valassis considers applicants for all positions without regard to race, color, creed, religion, national origin or ancestry, sex, age, disability, genetic information, veteran status, or any other legally protected status. In addition, Valassis will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities.

The Head Of The CAD Group Will
  • Plan the CAD designers’ workload and set priorities in agreement with the projects requesting the tasks.
  • Assign CAD designers to tasks and monitor their progress.
  • Manage the configuration model of NSTX-U and other plants of sufficient complexity requiring this function.
  • Support the management of CATIA/ENOVIA systems and compliance with US ITER and ITER design standards.
  • Manage the implementation of Engineering Change Notices (ECN).
  • Support responsible engineers in the resolution of Deviation Requests (DR) and Non-Conformity Reports (NCR).
  • Plan designers’ hardware and software upgrades and training.

The Role Responsibilities Are

 Responsibilities
  • Work progress monitoring and troubleshooting 30%
  • ECN management 20%
  • Workload planning 15%
  • Configuration management 15%
  • DR and NCR management 10%
  • Maintain and update CAD Drafting Standards 5%
  • Plan and implement staff training 5%

Education And Experience

 Qualifications
  • Education: Associate degree in Mechanical Design Technology or equivalent as a minimum.
  • Experience: Management of similar size drafting office in complex cross-functional design projects for at least 5 years.
    • Management of configuration model of similar complexity for at least 5 years.

Knowledge, Skills, And Abilities
  • Proficient in PTC Creo and PTC Windchill; working knowledge of CATIA and AutoCAD is desirable.

Working Conditions
  • Office based.

whole_unnormalized_body:
Job Description

Responsibilities:
  • Work with higher-level product managers to develop marketing programs and initiatives to enhance sales force effectiveness and deliver product line growth , including development of product positioning through pricing, promotions, communications, and go-to-market plans
  • Develop and maintain product line technical expertise and contacts with key customers of product responsibility by observing surgery and attending medical/scientific meetings, presentations, and seminars
  • Provide product support to the sales force, surgeon customers, and internal stakeholders
  • Contribute to development of strategic plan for current and future development of the product line through assessment of market conditions and customer requirements
  • Coordinate product/strategy implementation by working with cross-functional teams, including Engineering, Marketing Communications, Compliance, Legal, Regulatory Affairs, etc.
  • Ability to travel 25-30%

Who We're Looking For
  • Highly engaged and adaptable – self motivated and driven with the ability to learn and adapt in a fast-paced environment
  • Customer-oriented high achiever – unparalleled work ethic and customer-focused approach, keeping the customer top-of-mind in everything they do
  • Relationship builder – builds and maintains relationships internally and with key customer groups that drive business performance
  • Team player – puts team above all else and is willing to roll up their sleeves to get the job done

Education/Experience Requirements
  • BA/BS Degree Business, Marketing, Engineering, or related field preferred
  • 1-2 Years experience in medical device industry preferred

About Djo Global

DJO Global is a leading global developer, manufacturer and distributor of high-quality medical devices that provide solutions for musculoskeletal health, vascular health and pain management. Our products address the continuum of patient care from injury prevention to rehabilitation after surgery, injury or from degenerative disease, enabling people to regain or maintain their natural motion. Our products are used by orthopedic specialists, spine surgeons, primary care physicians, pain management specialists, physical therapists, podiatrists, chiropractors, athletic trainers and other healthcare professionals. In addition, many of our medical devices and related accessories are used by athletes and patients for injury prevention and at-home physical therapy treatment. Product lines include rigid and soft orthopedic bracing, hot and cold therapy, bone growth stimulators, vascular therapy systems and compression garments, therapeutic shoes and inserts, electrical stimulators used for pain management and physical therapy products. Our surgical division offers a comprehensive suite of reconstructive joint products for the hip, knee and shoulder. Our products are marketed under a portfolio of brands including Aircast®, Chattanooga, CMF™, Compex®, DonJoy®, ProCare®, Exos™, Dr. Comfort®, DonJoy Performance® and DJO® Surgical.

For Additional Information On The Company, Please Visit Www.DJOglobal.com.

DJO is a growing subsidiary of diversified technology leader Colfax Corporation

whole_unnormalized_body:
Overview

Featuring state-of-the-art technology and specialized care units, Apollo showcases how Greystone facilities stand out from the crowd. Located just west of I-275 on the corner of 24th Street and 9th Avenue, this 99-bed facility is just blocks away from St. Anthony's Hospital and Bayfront Medical Center. Our separate Rapid Recovery Unit offers luxurious private suites to make the rehabilitation experience comfortable and convenient. With meals served restaurant style in our elegant dining room, Apollo emphasizes individualized and compassionate care.

Responsibilities

Heroes Work Here, Work Where People Matter!

Healthcare workers are ESSENTIAL employees and often unsung heroes, putting their lives on the line daily to help others. In the face of the COVID-19 pandemic,

we are looking for heroes that want to come join our TEAM and HELP others. If you are passionate about taking CARE of others and LOVE what you do,

Greystone Health is the place to work.

We LOVE OUR HEROES and their families for the selflessness they demonstrate in taking care of our residents and their families. JOIN US NOW!

The responsibilities of the MDS Coordinator include but is not limited to overseeing and coordinating the development and completion of the member assessment (MDS) in accordance with current Federal and state regulations, coordinating and leading the development of a comprehensive member assessment and care plan for each member as chairperson of the community Interdisciplinary Plan of Care team, ensuring the face validity of all Minimum Data Sets before electronic submission and combine the timely electronic submission of all MDS, and conducting a monthly review of a random sample of the MDS to ensure accuracy and internal consistency with the medical records.

Qualifications
  • Must be an active Registered Nurse (RN) in good standing licensed by the state where our facility is located (FL, IL or MO).
  • Must have at least 2 years’ experience as a Nurse.
  • Must have knowledge in PPS assessment as well as OBRA compliance.
  • Demonstrates clinical assessment skills at the level necessary to meet the job requirements.
  • Ability to make independent decisions and follow through with limited supervision.
  • Knowledgeable and understanding of state and federal regulations and guidelines governing the practices of the facility.
  • Effective interpersonal skills and the ability to work cooperatively with an interdisciplinary care team.
  • Able to relate positively, favorably and cooperatively with others, including, members, family members, associates and personnel of outside agencies and organizations.

Benefits

Depending upon your job classification you may be eligible for participation in our comprehensive benefits program.
  • Health, dental, vision and life insurance. Your well-being is important, and we value it.
  • Paid time off. Because as much as you love your job, we want you to also love having time to be you.
  • A 401K retirement plan. You're our company's future; let us help you take care of yours.
  • Continuing education credits. Life, learning, and education are our top priorities.
  • Tuition reimbursement. The more you know, the more we can grow together.
  • Referral bonus program. Refer a friend. Receive a bonus. Help us build great teams.
  • As a growing organization, we offer many different career paths to help you achieve your professional goals
The best people, the best communities, the best services for the best reason: Serving our patients. That means making sure we have the best team available who believe that taking care of our staff is just as important to us as taking care of our patients.

Click Apply to join the Greystone Health Family!

Go to our website for more info and career opportunities www.greystonehealthcareers.com

Like Us on Facebook under Greystone Healthcare Management

Follow us on Linked In under Greystone Health Network

whole_unnormalized_body:
Position Description

Position Title: Marketing Coordinator

Reports To: Marketing Director

Classification: Exempt

Position Overview

The Marketing Coordinator reports to the Marketing Manager and will support the development, management and enhancement of existing and future marketing campaigns and programs. This position will focus heavily on promotional and event campaign support and execution, Grand Opening coordination and local marketing initiatives. This role primarily interfaces with the marketing team, design team, retail operations and at times with our customers.

Essential Functions
  • Responsible for managing the SPB monthly/quarterly promotional calendar timing
  • Work in cross-functional setting with Retail Ops, Product and Training/Education to ensure alignment of promotional campaigns designed to meet business goals
  • Collaborate with design team to develop digital and in-store creative assets to support promotional events and generate awareness. Some copy writing is required.
  • Communicate effectively all event, marketing and other local marketing details to internal stakeholders
  • Assist with the Pre/Post store Grand Opening marketing plans, collateral and direct execution with agency. Some travel to Grand Openings may occur.
  • Manage online portal that hosts marketing collateral for stores
  • Assist with planning and preparation of localized store events, manufacturer events and other local partnership opportunities
  • Performs other duties as directed by the Marketing Manager.

COMPETENCIES
  • Strong analytical skills
  • Strong MS Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, and Outlook) skills required
  • Strong written, oral and presentation skills
  • Strong attention to detail and follow through. Ability to multi-task and prioritize under deadlines
  • Thrives in entrepreneurial environment - can be scrappy, creative and resourceful while also building structure and process. Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional team members to meet objectives
  • Ability to think creatively and critically as an individual while working effectively with a team
  • Comfort working in a fast-paced, constantly changing environment


Desired Skills & Experience

Possess the following core values:
  • Curious
  • Passionate
  • Honest
  • Adaptable
  • Confident
  • BS/BA degree preferably in marketing.
  • 1-2 years relevant marketing and advertising.
  • Retail experience preferred.

    • WORK ENVIRONMENT

    This job operates in a professional office environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, filing cabinets and fax machines. This is an on-site job located at our Main Office, with some travel to Stores.

    PHYSICAL DEMANDS

    This is largely a sedentary role; however, some filing is required. This would require the ability to lift files, open filing cabinets and bend or stand as necessary. Additionally, specific vision abilities required include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and the ability to adjust focus. The employee may occasionally lift or move up to 25 pounds.

    NOTE: This job description may be changed or updated as necessary and is not inclusive of all the duties and responsibilities that may be expected to be performed.

Position Description

Position Title: Marketing Coordinator

Reports To: Marketing Director

Classification: Exempt

Position Overview

The Marketing Coordinator reports to the Marketing Manager and will support the development, management and enhancement of existing and future marketing campaigns and programs. This position will focus heavily on promotional and event campaign support and execution, Grand Opening coordination and local marketing initiatives. This role primarily interfaces with the marketing team, design team, retail operations and at times with our customers.

Essential Functions
  • Responsible for managing the SPB monthly/quarterly promotional calendar timing
  • Work in cross-functional setting with Retail Ops, Product and Training/Education to ensure alignment of promotional campaigns designed to meet business goals
  • Collaborate with design team to develop digital and in-store creative assets to support promotional events and generate awareness. Some copy writing is required.
  • Communicate effectively all event, marketing and other local marketing details to internal stakeholders
  • Assist with the Pre/Post store Grand Opening marketing plans, collateral and direct execution with agency. Some travel to Grand Openings may occur.
  • Manage online portal that hosts marketing collateral for stores
  • Assist with planning and preparation of localized store events, manufacturer events and other local partnership opportunities
  • Performs other duties as directed by the Marketing Manager.

COMPETENCIES
  • Strong analytical skills
  • Strong MS Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, and Outlook) skills required
  • Strong written, oral and presentation skills
  • Strong attention to detail and follow through. Ability to multi-task and prioritize under deadlines
  • Thrives in entrepreneurial environment - can be scrappy, creative and resourceful while also building structure and process. Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional team members to meet objectives
  • Ability to think creatively and critically as an individual while working effectively with a team
  • Comfort working in a fast-paced, constantly changing environment


Desired Skills & Experience

Possess the following core values:
  • Curious
  • Passionate
  • Honest
  • Adaptable
  • Confident
  • BS/BA degree preferably in marketing.
  • 1-2 years relevant marketing and advertising.
  • Retail experience preferred.

    • WORK ENVIRONMENT

    This job operates in a professional office environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, filing cabinets and fax machines. This is an on-site job located at our Main Office, with some travel to Stores.

    PHYSICAL DEMANDS

    This is largely a sedentary role; however, some filing is required. This would require the ability to lift files, open filing cabinets and bend or stand as necessary. Additionally, specific vision abilities required include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and the ability to adjust focus. The employee may occasionally lift or move up to 25 pounds.

    NOTE: This job description may be changed or updated as necessary and is not inclusive of all the duties and responsibilities that may be expected to be performed.

Loan Processing Assistant Remote on W2 No Interview

For over ten years, Highlight has provided Development and Modernization, Secure IT and Mission Solutions for our federal government customers. We know the technology we understand the way our customers and their stakeholders work and we know how to implement industry best practices for development and services, delivering end-to-end solutions that minimize risk and maximize results. Overview

Highlight is seeking highly-qualified individuals for Loan Processing Assistant positions to support the Small Business Administration (SBA) remotely. You will be performing duties necessary to the processing, servicing, liquidating, or other transactions for all types of SBA loans. Excellent customer service skills are a must. The ideal candidates will also enjoy learning new software skills. Responsibilities bullIndependently manage an assigned portfolio of loans and concentrate on loans delinquent for the purpose of securing payments to bring the loan current by making telephone calls and writing collection letters to borrowers. bullKeep loan specialists informed of borrowerrsquos payment record referring delinquent loans over one hundred twenty days (120) for further action by loan officers. bullPrepare summary recommendations to supervisory or lead loan specialist for review or appropriate actions. bullEnsure all routine transactions requirements are accomplished for assigned loans. bullSpread and analyze borrowerrsquos financial statements, compare with statements previously furnished to determine trends in financial condition and to determine compliance with loan terms and conditions, particularly with respect to salaries, whether pledged assets have been disposed of and whether additional assets have been acquired. Bring to the attention of the supervisory loan specialist andor lead loan specialist any adverse change in financial condition or any serious violation of loan agreement. bullPrepare and analyze information to develop transaction documents, such as the SBA Form 327, involving, for example, deferment of payments, extension of loan maturity, temporary increasedecrease of installment payments, charge off and referral to treasury, etchellip This requires the ability to read and analyze financial statements to determine whether the borrowerrsquos request should be approved or declined. In doubtful or more difficult cases, consults with lead loan specialists and possibly, a SBA supervisory loan specialist. bullAnswer basic credit requests from individual borrowers, banks, and other financing agencies. This involves stating whether or not the loan is current, the original amount of the loan, the loan balance, and our experience with the borrower. bullAble to complete tasks related to loan administration such as loan collections, charging off loans, ordering lien searches, making minor modification to loans and transferring loans to and from liquidation status. bullHighly skilled in oral and written communication to extract needed information and to ensure effective response to SBA borrowers or stakeholders. Qualifications bullAbility to obtain a Public Trust clearance. bullAssociate's degree preferred. bullPractical knowledge of loan administration and basic account principles. bullProficient in Microsoft Word, Excel and Outlook. bullExcellent verbal and written communication skills. bullComprehensive knowledge of the substantive programs of Small Business Administration and they relate to loan administration functions. bullKnowledge of duties, priorities, commitments, policies and goals of the office sufficient to perform assignments such as telephone requests and other inquiries. bullPractical knowledge of standard procedures in loan administration requiring extended experience to perform such work as preparation of the more routine modification of loan terms and conditions. bullKnowledge of financial statements, credit instruments, collateral documents and business terminology. bullSkill and ability to use calculator, typewriter andor personal computer to complete forms, recurring reports and correspondence which is generated by job activity. bullSkill and ability to deal with situations on the telephone involving individuals who may not understand the Agencyrsquos programs or who have complaints or grievances with the Agency. bullJudgment in locating and selecting the most appropriate guidelines, references, and procedures for application and in making minor deviations to adopt the guidelines in specific cases, may determine which of several established alternatives to use. Thomas Allen is Hiring for a Community Living Adviser!

Paid training is provided!

Two Positions Available
  • Cottage Grove:
    • Wednesdays 1pm - 4pm
      Assist an individual with attending community activities
    • 3 hours per week 1p-4p - day of week is flexible
      Running errands and doing fun activities

Qualifications
  • Must have 1 year of related experience working with individuals with disabilities
  • Willing to commit to and implement person-centered supports
  • Department of Human Services background clearance
  • Valid driver's license, reliable vehicle, acceptable driving record, and proof of auto insurance required
  • Must be 18 years or older
  • Ability to effectively communicate in English, both written and verbally
To view other open positions, clickhere.

AA/EOE

Thomas Allen, Inc. is a social services agency that provides person-centered services to individuals with disabilities. Proudly, we offer a diverse array of services including residential group home support, case management, and guardianship.

Thomas Allen is known as a reputable and growing agency that delivers trusted and dependable services, which is made possible through the talent, skills, and commitment shared by a team of over 700 employees. As our agency continues to grow, we are looking for team members who are passionate about providing respectful and responsive services that empower those we support to live meaningful and purposeful lives.

Job Posted by ApplicantPro

Position Tableau Admin Location San Francisco, CA Duration 12+ Months

Job Description As a BI Engineer, you will be a part of an early stage team that builds the data transport, collection, and storage, and exposes services that make data a first-class citizen. We are looking for a BI Engineer to build a scalable data platform.

Required Skill Sets Experience with Tableau Admin. Python or similar language for automation Solid understanding in data development (ETL, Reporting, Database) An ability to collaborate and work with functional teams, such as IT, Privacy, Security, Data.

Responsibilities Administer BI tools (Mode, Looker, Tableau). Upgrade tools, addremove users, scale the back-end, and keep the lights on Security integration Work with security and privacy teams to build the appropriate security. Develop automations. Build an automatic license and security provisioning (find inactive users then disable. find employees who left and easily disable their license. Integrate with TOM and automatically add users to the right groups. Automatically find scheduled and non-scheduled jobs that are not been used and clean up. Build connectors and other functions to scale the tool for larger group of users. (eg. airflow, presto, druid, etc).

Nice to have Skill Sets Experience with Mode Admin

Thanks,

Ram Chapala 510-854-1323 ram.cmythriconsulting.com mailtoram.cmythriconsulting.com

We are lookingfor an Intake Coordinator to join our Intake team as we grow to be one of thetop home infusion providers in the country. The Intake Coordinator will reportto the General Manager and work in our Centennial, CO branch.Amerita is an entrepreneurial-founded company and a wholly owned subsidiary ofPharMerica. The home infusion market is positioned for rapid growth driven bythe aging population, increase in chronic diseases, robust pipeline ofinfusible drugs coming to market, and an industry shift from hospitaldelivery settings to lower-cost, high-quality alternative providers such asAmeAs a core member of the Intake team, you will have primary responsiblity forthe timely clearance of new referrals. whole_unnormalized_body:
Requisition ID: 242067
Work Area: Marketing
Expected Travel: 0 - 10%
Career Status: Student
Employment Type: Intern

Company Description

SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.
SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives.

About The Team

As a small but mighty design team within SAP’s Palo Alto campus, we celebrate diversity across cultures, hobbies, and disciplines. We enjoy a light-hearted, casual environment that allows different personalities and work styles to thrive.

Our team likes to think of ourselves not just as designers, but as thinkers and tinkerers too. We spend as much time researching, brainstorming, and validating as we do designing and implementing our ideas. Our skills involve research, interaction design, visual design, product management, and development. We all come together with one main purpose — from the first sticky notes of a design-thinking workshop, to the last lines of code — to design, develop, and deliver high-quality, user-centered and delightful products.

About The Job

As a Visual Design Intern, you will get a chance to own design topics and take them from ideation to execution. You will be involved in different aspects of the product design and development process while working closely with designers, product managers, engineers and other stakeholders. You will also have mentors/design buddies who will guide and work with you to make sure your internship is impactful and rewarding.

If you are someone who cares about the details as much as the larger picture, has a passion for learning, is eager to solve complex problems, and strives to deliver quality work, we welcome you to join our family

What You’ll Do
  • Help define product vision in a multi-disciplinary team
  • Create visual experiences that are incredibly simple and elegant
  • Create storyboards, mockups, and prototypes to communicate UX design ideas
  • Verify designs through reviews, validations, and usability testing
  • Provide visual design support for a wide range of visual design initiatives
  • Collaborate with fellow visual designers, interaction designers, user researchers, product owners, and developers

What You’ll Bring
  • Recently completed or working towards a degree in graphic design, visual design, or other related fields
  • Exceptional portfolio showcasing a wide range of visual design work on mobile and web applications, digital experiences, corporate communications, and/or branding
  • Experience in UI design including user-centered design methods
  • Excellent oral and written skills, and a demonstrated proficiency in effective communication with product stakeholders and research subjects
  • In-depth knowledge of color, typography, iconography, space, and texture

Nice To Have
  • Previous internship or related experience in visual design, interaction design, and/or user research
  • Strong understanding of mobile/web design trends and requirements
  • Ability to create wireframes or animations to effectively convey dynamic interactions to developers
  • Video production, motion graphics, photography, and/or animation skills
  • Ability to build visual designs in HTML/CSS

What You Get From Us

Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own.
A career at SAP can open many doors for you. If you’re searching for a company that’s dedicated to your ideas and individual growth, recognizes you for your unique contributions, fills you with a strong sense of purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment – apply now.

SAP'S DIVERSITY COMMITMENT
To harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company.

SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team. (Americas:Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com or Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com, APJ: Careers.APJ@sap.com, EMEA: Careers@sap.com). Requests for reasonable accommodation will be considered on a case-by-case basis. Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.

Work Area: Marketing
Expected Travel: 0 - 10%
Career Status: Student
Employment Type: Intern

Company Description

SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.
SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives.

About The Team

As a small but mighty design team within SAP’s Palo Alto campus, we celebrate diversity across cultures, hobbies, and disciplines. We enjoy a light-hearted, casual environment that allows different personalities and work styles to thrive.

Our team likes to think of ourselves not just as designers, but as thinkers and tinkerers too. We spend as much time researching, brainstorming, and validating as we do designing and implementing our ideas. Our skills involve research, interaction design, visual design, product management, and development. We all come together with one main purpose — from the first sticky notes of a design-thinking workshop, to the last lines of code — to design, develop, and deliver high-quality, user-centered and delightful products.

About The Job

As a Visual Design Intern, you will get a chance to own design topics and take them from ideation to execution. You will be involved in different aspects of the product design and development process while working closely with designers, product managers, engineers and other stakeholders. You will also have mentors/design buddies who will guide and work with you to make sure your internship is impactful and rewarding.

If you are someone who cares about the details as much as the larger picture, has a passion for learning, is eager to solve complex problems, and strives to deliver quality work, we welcome you to join our family

What You’ll Do
  • Help define product vision in a multi-disciplinary team
  • Create visual experiences that are incredibly simple and elegant
  • Create storyboards, mockups, and prototypes to communicate UX design ideas
  • Verify designs through reviews, validations, and usability testing
  • Provide visual design support for a wide range of visual design initiatives
  • Collaborate with fellow visual designers, interaction designers, user researchers, product owners, and developers

What You’ll Bring
  • Recently completed or working towards a degree in graphic design, visual design, or other related fields
  • Exceptional portfolio showcasing a wide range of visual design work on mobile and web applications, digital experiences, corporate communications, and/or branding
  • Experience in UI design including user-centered design methods
  • Excellent oral and written skills, and a demonstrated proficiency in effective communication with product stakeholders and research subjects
  • In-depth knowledge of color, typography, iconography, space, and texture

Nice To Have
  • Previous internship or related experience in visual design, interaction design, and/or user research
  • Strong understanding of mobile/web design trends and requirements
  • Ability to create wireframes or animations to effectively convey dynamic interactions to developers
  • Video production, motion graphics, photography, and/or animation skills
  • Ability to build visual designs in HTML/CSS

What You Get From Us

Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own.
A career at SAP can open many doors for you. If you’re searching for a company that’s dedicated to your ideas and individual growth, recognizes you for your unique contributions, fills you with a strong sense of purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment – apply now.

whole_unnormalized_body:
Job Description

The Admission Counselor is responsible for recruiting students for the Chicago campus. The Admission Counselor is responsible for all phases of the admission process, from successfully marketing the programs to qualifying students for admission selection and enrollment. The successful candidate will be an articulate, organized, results driven, dynamic and enthusiastic leader and team player. This position provides an excellent opportunity for a talented and committed professional whose skills and attitude complement a dynamic, collegial team.

Principal Duties
  • Clearly articulates the mission and value of the designated higher education affiliate institution(s) to prospective undergraduate and/or graduate students
  • Provides superior customer service to students through the entire admission process
  • Consistently achieves performance goals for each term by maintaining targeted conversion metrics at each stage of the admission process
  • Responds to all new inquiries quickly and maintains consistent communication with all students throughout the admission process
  • Completes a high level of outbound calls per day to reach prospective students in a timely manner
  • Conducts telephone-based personal interviews to qualify prospective students on their educational goals and interests, to explain available academic programs, to advise them on admission requirements, and to ensure that all admission paperwork is completed properly. Provides more in-depth counseling for undecided students
  • Makes decisions concerning admission, appropriately adhering to all policies and procedures
  • Acts as the Office of Admission liaison for one or more academic programs
  • Produces accurate applicant and inquiry reports, including forecasts, on a regular basis.
  • Performs other duties as assigned
Qualifications
  • A Bachelor's degree is required (Master's degree preferred)
  • A minimum of 1 year sales experience or similar background is required (telesales preferred)
  • Previous admissions experience is preferred but not required
  • The ability to work evenings and weekends is required
  • Some occasional travel may also be required
  • Must be able to represent the organization in a professional manner, recruit and work within a diverse community, and follow all policies and procedures with a keen attention to detail
  • Excellent communication and listening abilities: persuasive and negotiation skills, strong professional writing, public speaking, interpersonal and public relations skills
  • Strong recruitment, sales, and customer service skills combined with a strong work ethic and a goal-oriented, self-motivated approach toward achieving consistent results
  • Leadership, organizational, time management, multi-tasking, and planning capabilities
  • Computer skills including proficiency with the Microsoft Office Suite, as well as experience using customer relationship management systems and the ability to learn new systems quickly
For more information about The Chicago School of Professional Psychology visit www.thechicagoschool.edu
The Chicago School of Professional Psychology offers a generous compensation and benefits package, as well as the opportunity to work for a leader in the field of education. Some of our key benefits include: generous paid time-off, medical and dental coverage, company-paid life and disability insurance, retirement plan with employer contribution, multiple flexible spending accounts (FSA), tuition reimbursement, professional development, and regular employee appreciation events.
The Chicago School of Professional Psychology is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
Company Name: The Chicago School of Professional Psychology

Purpose of Job
We are currently seeking talented Data Engineers – Mid Level & Senior Level for our Plano Facility

USAA is on a journey to snowflake and we our looking for some of the best and brightest data engineers that can guide us on the slopes…so if you have dabbled on cloud migrations and are ready for the challenge please check out USAA’s Data Engineering positions in Plano, TX.

Data Engineers deliver quality reporting and data intelligence solutions to the organization and assist client teams with drawing insights to make informed, data driven decisions. Data Engineers (DEs) are engaged in all phases of the data management lifecycle; gather and analyze requirements, collect, process, store and secure, use, share and communicate, archive, reuse and repurpose data. Identify and manage existing and emerging risks that stem from business activities and ensure these risks are effectively identified and escalated to be measured, monitored and controlled.

Job Requirements

About Usaa

USAA knows what it means to serve. We facilitate the financial security of millions of U.S. military members and their families. This singular mission requires a dedication to innovative thinking at every level. In each of the past five years, we've been a top-40 Fortune 100 Best Companies to Work For®, and we've ranked among Victory Media's Top 10 Military Friendly® Employers 13 years straight. We embrace a robust veteran workforce and encourage veterans and veteran spouses to apply.

About Usaa It

Our most important qualification isn't technical, it's human. Here, we don't just sit in front of a screen. We stand behind our 11 million members who rely on us every day. We are over 3,000 employees strong, a passionately supportive and collaborative team built on agile principles. We've been a top-two Computerworld 100 Best Places to Work in IT five years in a row and were recently named a Top 50 Employer for Minority Engineers & IT by Workforce Diversity Magazine.

See what it's like to work for a company where your passion meets our purpose:

USAA Information Technology: A Realistic Preview

Tasks
  • Identifies and manages existing and emerging risks that stem from business activities and the job role.
  • Ensures risks associated with business activities are effectively identified, measured, monitored, and controlled.
  • Follows written risk and compliance policies and procedures for business activities.
  • Design and implement technical solutions.
  • Identify and solve significant technical problems and architecture deficiencies.
  • Participate in daily standups and design reviews.
  • Breakdown business features and into technical stories and approaches.
  • Analyze data and enable machine learning.
  • Create proof of concepts and prototypes.
  • Help on-board entry level engineers.
  • Collaborate with the team and other engineers to plan and execute assignments and tasks.
  • May begin mentoring junior engineers.

Minimum Requirements
  • Bachelor's degree in related field of study OR Certification from an approved technical field of study OR 4 additional years of related experience beyond the minimum required.
  • 4 years of data management experience implementing data solutions demonstrating depth of technical understanding within a specific discipline(s)/technology(s)

*Qualifications may warrant placement in a different job level*

When you apply for this position, you will be required to answer some initial questions. This will take approximately 5 minutes. Once you begin the questions you will not be able to finish them at a later time and you will not able to change your responses.

Preferred Experience
  • 4 or more years of ETL/ELT Development in tools like DataStage or Informatica
  • 2 or more years of Java or Python programming experience.
  • 1 or more years of experience building streaming data pipelines (Kafka, NiFi, Spark, Hadoop)
  • 4+ years writing complex SQL including performance tuning on multiple platforms
  • Experience with predictive analytics implementations
  • Exposure to cloud-platforms and the journey from on-prem to cloud (AWS, GCP, Azure, Snowflake, ect)
  • Experience with Agile Development methodologies

The above description reflects the details considered necessary to describe the principal functions of the job and should not be construed as a detailed description of all the work requirements that may be performed in the job.

At USAA our employees enjoy one of the best benefits packages in the business, including a flexible business casual or casual dress environment, comprehensive medical, dental and vision plans, along with wellness and wealth building programs. Additionally, our career path planning and continuing education will assist you with your professional goals.

Relocation assistance is available for this position.

For Internal Candidates

Must complete 12 months in current position (from date of hire or date of placement) or must have manager’s approval prior to posting.

Last day for internal candidates to apply to the opening is 4/5/20 by 11:59 pm CST time.

High School Diploma or equivalent required. Previous experience in a healthcare environment required. Previous customer service and/or MD order entry experience preferred.

About Our Company

C&S Wholesale Grocers, Inc. , based in Keene, NH, is the largest wholesale grocery supply company in the U.S. and the industry leader in supply chain innovation. Founded in 1918 as a supplier to independent grocery stores, C&S now services customers of all sizes, supplying more than 6,000 independent supermarkets, chain stores, military bases, and institutions with over 150,000 different products. At C&S, We Select the Best® – those with the motivation, pride, and drive to succeed in our fast-paced world.

Working Safely is a Condition of Employment at C&S Wholesale Grocers, Inc. C&S Wholesale Grocers is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer, and considers qualified applicants without regard to race, color, creed, religion, ancestry, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, veteran status or any other protected factor under federal, state or local law.

Position Overview

As an Administrative Assistant, you will perform departmental project tracking activities. You will act as an interface between employees, other departments, and vendors. In this role, you will provide administrative support to the Department Manager as well as the entire compliance team on a daily basis. You will manage daily schedules and assist the department in preparation for scheduled meetings.

Job Description
  • Daily tracking of projects including developing and maintaining project plans, budgets, and staffing requirements. Tracks progress and identifies/resolves obstacles. Ensures that all team members involved are on target for successful completion of the project. Recommends adjustments to the project plan based on achievements to date.
  • Ensure department is prepared for all scheduled meetings; prepare materials, including presentations; facilitate others' participation to ensure meeting efficiency, etc.
  • Compose letters, spreadsheets and PowerPoint presentations
  • Create and maintain filing system
  • Manage daily administrative tasks (filing, photocopying, mail, faxing, etc.)
  • Answer phones and take accurate messages
  • Execute minutes at all Team related meetings and ensure action items are followed through to completion
  • Track status of project tasks for updates and progress and reports gaps between target and actual status
  • Manage multiple calendars; assist in organization and preparedness
  • Prepare and distribute documents, reports, and presentations using Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint
  • Coordinate conference calls and appointments with multiple participants
  • TC Facilitator – Fill in as needed
  • Other duties as assigned


Qualifications
  • Associate's Degree or equivalent combination of education and experience
  • Three to five years' relevant experience; prior experience supporting senior level executives preferably someone with experience supporting multiple executives
  • Advanced understanding of Microsoft Outlook, Word, PowerPoint, Excel
  • Excellent written and overbal communication skills
  • Ability to manage multiple projects, perform job functions w/ minimal supervision
  • Strong organizational and time management skills
  • Strong ability to act as the department intranet site webmaster, ensuring appropriate development and management of the site
  • High level of professionalism
  • Superior people skills
  • Sound judgment; high standard of integrity and reliability; ability to remain strictly confidential is a must
  • Ability to use an effective customer service approach
  • Compliance with all C&S policies and procedures
  • Authorization to work in the United States or the ability to obtain the same
  • Successful completion of pre-employment drug testing and background check


Qualifications

Attendance, Initiative, Productivity, Quality, Safety, Values

Shift

1st Shift (United States of America)

Company

C&S Wholesale Grocers, Inc.

Founded in 1918 as a supplier to independent grocery stores, C&S now services customers of all sizes, supplying more than 6,000 independent supermarkets, chain stores, military bases, and institutions with over 150,000 different products. whole_unnormalized_body:
As a Relationship Banker, you will help clients achieve financial well-being through deep customer relationships and a thoughtful understanding of their needs, to offer the best and most appropriate personal and business financial products and services. You will also provide sales and service support to the Retail Store team and serve as the primary new account and loan originator for the store.

Functions
  • Build, develop and deepen customer relationships through active market profiling, and needs-based questioning to identify deposit, credit, and investment solutions to help customers achieve their financial goals. Solutions include, services and current technologies the Bank offers that are available for customer convenience. Educate customers on alternative channels that provide value, and then refer to appropriate lines of business.
  • Establish preset appointments, deliver quality Financial Wellness Review conversations, identify needs, make recommendations and follow up.
  • Assist the customer with their financial growth through savvy advice and educating the customer on alternative channels that provide value and refer to appropriate lines of business. Develop strong partnerships with Operations Leaders, Financial Advisors, Mortgage Advisors, Small Business colleagues and other line of business partners focusing on client acquisition and deepening the relationship of current clients; effectively manage those partnerships.
  • Originate simple to complex consumer lending inside the Store.
  • Originate limited Small Business loans as well as provides cash management solutions, such as Treasury Management and Merchant Services, payroll and ACH.
  • Recognize a small business with potential and make a quality referrals to the proper team.
  • Cross-sell other bank services and refer customers to other departments as appropriate.
  • Demonstrate compliance with all bank regulations that apply to your position, and keep up to date on regulation changes.
  • Maintain working knowledge of our policies and procedures regarding the Bank Secrecy Act, Regulation CC, Regulation E, Bank Security and other regulations that apply to your position.


Qualifications
  • High school diploma or GED required.
  • 3-5 years of banking and/or demonstrated sales experience.
  • 1 year of experience in developing current and new customer relationships, achieving sales goals and building referral sources in banking or retail environment with customer service and cash handling experience.
  • 1 year experience in a lending function with loan origination and processing functions, or equivalent training. This position requires National Mortgage Licensing System (NMLS) registration under the terms of the S.A.F.E. Act of 2008 and Reg Z.
  • Foundational knowledge of sales and service techniques with consumers and small businesses, including tele-consulting, outside calling, prospecting and networking. Basic understanding of personal finances and concept of budgeting.
  • Must have access to reliable transportation to facilitate travel outside of the branches, including outside sales calls.

Registered Mortgage Loan Originator (MLO)

This position requires you to act as a Bank MLO, which is defined as an individual authorized by the Bank to take mortgage loan applications, offer a mortgage, arrange a mortgage, assist a consumer in obtaining or applying to obtain a mortgage, negotiates a mortgage, otherwise obtain or make a mortgage for another person, represent to the public (through advertising or other means of communication) that such person can or will perform any of these activities, or, refer a consumer to a loan originator (Note: Except those employees of the Bank who do not discuss particular credit terms available and do not refer the consumer, based on the employee's assessment of the consumer's financial characteristics to a particular Bank MLO), for compensation or gain. All MLO's will be required to register as a MLO complying with the S.A.F.E. Act requirements.
  • This position is NOT authorized to act as a Bank Closed-End MLO which is defined as any position designated to perform the activities of a Bank MLO for closed-end transactions, and thus subject to specific Truth-in-Lending Act and Regulation Z Loan Originator requirements.


Work Involves

Physical Requirements and Working Conditions
  • Sitting
  • occasional walking
  • lifting up to 10 pounds
  • Frequent local travel.

No relocation offered.

About Us

We do things a little differently here at Umpqua. Our retail stores serve as community hubs, our associates are given up to 40 hours of volunteer time each year, and we're never satisfied with the status quo. It's no wonder we've made "Fortune's 100 Best Companies to Work For" eight years in a row. But greatness has no finish line, so we continue every day to keep people at the center of everything we do. We focus on building relationships, understanding our customers' needs and connecting to people in new and innovative ways -- always staying true to our mission of providing personalized banking for all people, whenever and however they prefer to bank.

Umpqua Bank is committed to employing a diverse workforce. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, protected veteran status, or disability. We maintain a drug-free workplace and may perform pre-employment substance abuse testing.

Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled
