Are you interested in expanding your career through experience and exposure, all the while supporting a mission that seeks to ensure the security of our nation and its allies? If so, then Northrop Grumman may be the place for you. As a leading global security company providing innovative systems, products and solutions to customers worldwide, Northrop Grumman offers an extraordinary portfolio of capabilities and technologies. Here at Northrop Grumman we are comprised of professionals that bring different perspectives, are curious about the world, accepting of each other, and understand that the more ideas, backgrounds, and experiences we bring to our work then the more innovative we can be. As we continue to build our talented workforce we look for professionals that exemplify our core values, leadership characteristics, and approach to innovation.

Northrop Grumman Defense Systems sector is seeking a Systems Administrator to join our team of qualified, diverse individuals. Put your years of experience and training into a future of excellence by joining a Northrop Grumman team delivering cutting edge technology solutions to our clients. This position will be located in McLean, VA or Newport News, VA and support the DHA and operational medicine programs.

Northrop Grumman's Operational Medicine Innovation Lab has been instantiated over the last 2 years developing various evolutionary prototypes to meet the operational medical needs of our deployed warfighters. The Innovation Lab provides members the opportunity to work on modern technology stacks and methods and support tasks across the development spectrum.
As a System Administrator you will work closely with development, security and system engineering teams with creating, implementing, supporting and maintaining cloud-ready applications. Strong troubleshooting skills are required and familiarity with modern monitoring and provisioning tools preferred. Work may be done independently and / or as part of a team. Candidates will be supporting cloud and container environments, networking, storage, licensing, and provisioning.

The candidate will be able to work in a high paced, dynamic and aggressive program schedule environment with minimal supervision. In addition the candidate will possess effective writing skills, public speaking, organizational and customer service skills.

Responsibilities
  • Managing and administering the software development and testing environments
  • Onboard the team members by setting up their credentials and access to the appropriate environments and servers
  • Patch systems, scan systems for vulnerabilities (Security Center/Nessus, SCAP), harden systems (DISA STIGS), audit log files, update virus definitions and participate in successful IS accreditations/inspections
  • Plan for and maintain development networks, storage, COTS upgrades, virus definitions and collaboration
  • Design, implement and manage the user groups and roles
  • Implement and manage the password encryption, rotation and PKI certificates
  • Configure ALM tool to track system administration and onboarding requests
  • Design and maintain network infrastructure in the cloud environment
  • Develop network and computer security and testing strategies
  • Document all aspects of various system installation and configuration efforts step-by-step
  • Troubleshoot and recover system
  • Administer the ALM tools and configuration management process as prescribed by the program manager and customer.

Qualifications

Basic Qualifications:
  • Bachelor's Degree in a related technical field and a minimum of 9 years related technical experience. An additional 4 years of experience may be substituted in lieu of a Bachelor's degree. Or a Master's Degree in a related technical field and a minimum of 7 years related technical experience.
  • Experience with cross platform networks consisting of Linux and Windows Desktop
  • 3 years of Experience Administering Linux OS ( RedHat, CentOS,Ubuntu )
  • Experience with scripting languages such as Bash, Python, Perl, PowerShell
  • Experience setting up Virtual Desktop Infrastructure
  • Ability to obtain a Computing Environment certification (Linux, Windows, etc.) in compliance with DOD Directive 8570.01 requirements
  • Knowledge of network and web related protocols (e.g., TCP/IP, UDP, IPSEC, HTTP, HTTPS, routing protocols, etc.)
  • Knowledge of best practices and IT operations in an always-up, always-available service
  • US Citizenship and a Secret security clearance

Preferred Qualifications
  • Candidates with these desired skills will be given preferential consideration:
  • Experience with administering Azure or other cloud environments using DevOps tools such as Git, Maven, Jira, Ansible, Puppet, Docker, Kubernetes, Nexus, SonarQube, Fortify, ELK Stack (ElasticSearch, Logstash ,Kibana), Grafana, Prometheus
  • Experience with implementing secure solutions in Azure or other cloud environments using containers
  • RHCSA or equivalent Linux Certification
  • CISSP Certification
    Experience with SAFe Agile methodology
  • Experience in consulting to the Defense Health Agency (DHA) and/or the healthcare industry
  • Experience with the Theater Medical Information Program - Joint (TMIP-J) legacy systems including AHLTA-T, TC2, MCC, TMDS, MMM, DTRS, MSAT, TRAC2ES, DCAM
  • Experience with MHS Genesis
  • Active DHA Automated Data Processing/Information Technology (ADP/IT) I clearance
  • Expertise in testing interfaces and applications utilizing health IT interoperability standards such as DICOM, HL7, IHE, CDA, & FHIR
  • Experience with DoD C2 systems

Northrop Grumman is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class. For our complete EEO/AA and Pay Transparency statement, please visit www.northropgrumman.com/EEO. U.S. Citizenship is required for most positions.

position: Staff Enterprise Application Engineer (Oracle EBS Finance)
whole_unnormalized_body:
Role Summary:As Staff Enterprise Application Engineer, you will be responsible for creating strong working relationships within the GE Healthcare Biopharma Finance function and across the Corporate & IT Finance support organizations. You will partner with the Finance business teams and work closely with a diverse dev-ops team of architects, developers and operations personnel across global locations including US, Poland, UK, and India
Essential Responsibilities:All GE employees may be considered for this role. Candidates should note that this role will be in scope for the proposed transition of GE Biopharma to Danaher and will transfer to Danaher at close of this transaction.

As a domain expert for Oracle ERP Finance (Product), you will partner with GED-HC IT finance, at management and technical levels to develop/define/refine the Product strategy, support and influence Product direction and execute agreed upon strategy on time and within budget. You will also be responsible for the day to day operations of the Product, and ensure the Product is kept up and running meeting internal Service Level Agreements (SLAs).

In This Role, You Will
  • Architect and design solutions to complex business requirements
  • Evaluate requests for enhancements and determine potential impacts with the current system design/configuration
  • Support enhancements delivery for Finance requests with focus on speed, high quality and utilization of Out of Box Oracle ERP Functionality
  • Support strategic planning of Oracle EBS roadmap, including evaluation of digital technologies and Cloud offerings
  • Partner with FS&R, Corporate, Tax, and Enabling Functions teams to review business needs and recommend IT solutions
  • Provide functional design for application changes, Reports, Interfaces and localization requirements
  • Write functional specifications and document system changes
  • Understand the 21 CFR Part 11 regulations as they apply to Computer systems validation from a packaged application perspective
  • Provide business application architecture review, design & development for Product
  • Provide predictable service management to improve service to our end users of Product
  • Ensure Product compliance with regulatory, GE & GEHC Controls & audit support
  • Be a domain/business expert in Product to guide teams, establish/refine Product management processes
  • Work cross functionally across internal customers, analysts and senior management teams to formulate and execute the Product strategy
  • Responsible to create strong working relationship & influence across GE Healthcare business and other stakeholders
  • Manage and mentor junior level individual contributors
Qualifications/Requirements:
  • Bachelor’s Degree in Information Technology/related field
    • Oracle EBS implementation experience in different capacities
    • Good understanding of Financial functionalities in Oracle EBS
    • Demonstrated experience in Oracle's EBS Financials Modules including AP, AR, GL, FA, Project Accounting, Subledger Accounting, Cash Management
    • Experience in architecting global, large-scale applications, which span multiple countries and business units
    • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
    • Analytic, creative and business focused problem solver
    • Ability to explain issues and resolutions to technical and non-technical staff
    • Must be willing to travel
    Desired Characteristics:Technical Expertise:
    • Knowledge of Software Development Lifecycle process (SDLC)
    • Knowledge of Oracle products, specifically Oracle EBS ERP version 12+ and underlying database(s)
    • Extensive knowledge of operations processes including incident, problem and change management
    • Project management experience is a plus
    • SQL knowledge is a plus
    Business Acumen
    • Strong business analysis, problem solving, and strategy development skills
    • Evangelizes new technology, predicts trends, and identifies new opportunities based on trends
    • Identifies the customer’s business and strategic needs, concerns, and desires for the value delivery capabilities of the Product
    • Functional understanding of logistics, sourcing, manufacturing and close the books business processes
    • Ability to interact with Business stakeholders and solve business problems spanning across functions
    • Adept at business process change management.
    • Ability to interact at all levels of the organization and with other GE businesses
    • Extremely high degree of customer focus and responsiveness is a must
    About Us:GE (NYSE:GE) drives the world forward by tackling its biggest challenges. By combining world-class engineering with software and analytics, GE helps the world work more efficiently, reliably, and safely. GE people are global, diverse and dedicated, operating with the highest integrity and passion to fulfill GE’s mission and deliver for our customers. www.ge.comAdditional Locations:Poland, Sweden, United Kingdom, United States;Massachusetts;Krakow, Amersham, Uppsala, Marlborough;
